resources.string: Demo Mode will not interact with the ALMA public server or any real gadgets.

ALMA is a full scale home automation system.

Users interact with an Android device to remotely control and/or monitor gadgets located inside the user’s home network.

The user is free to implement a wide variety of gadget types, providing great modularity for the user. Gadgets may be all from lamps to temperature sensors or software implementations like CPU load or Wi-Fi strength.

The Android devices communicate with a public server, which in turn interacts with a home system server (hub) located inside the user’s local area network. The connections are of Server-Client architecture realized with TCP Sockets.
